result.execSummary:
The defendant Deidrik Steven Rear was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall pay court costs in this matter.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages or nonprescription controlled substances, or any prescription medicine for which the defendant does not have a current prescription.
Defendant shall not enter into any establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages.
Defendant shall not threaten or engage in any violent or abusive conduct directed toward Trina K. Rear.

Defendant shall consent to a reasonable request of a law enforcement officer, based on probable cause, to submit to a breath, blood, saliva, or urine test for purposes of determining the quantity of alcohol or drugs in defendant's breath, blood, saliva, or urine.
Defendant shall participate in any and all counseling deemed appropriate by the Division of Community Corrections.
Defendant shall abide by all other terms and conditions of probation deemed appropriate by the Division of Community Corrections.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA assessment and follow through with all recommendations thereof.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deidrik Steven Rear

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 9:24 AM.
Defendant Deidrik Steven Rear in court with attorney Dennis James Sieg.  Katherine M. Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Sieg informs the court this matter is resolved and filed plea and waiver form with the court.
Defendant changes plea from "NOT GUILTY" to "GUILTY"
Court questions defendant re: plea and waiver of rights, court also questions attorney Sieg re: his clients plea and waiver.
Parties stipulate to a factual basis.
Court finds plea and waiver is made freely, knowingly & intelligently.
Court accept plea and finds the defendant "GUILTY"
State moves for plea agreement, attorney Sieg concurs with the state.
Court grants motion of the parties and orders defendant be placed on probation for a period of 12 months with conditions.
Court dismisses enhancer of Domestic Abuse.
letter to Atty Sieg from Judge Jorgenson re: scheduling order

Pre-trial conference on December 19, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Motion hearing on January 3, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
Jury trial on January 19, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Case called at 1:32 PM.
Defendant Deidrik Steven Rear in court with attorney Dennis James Sieg.  Katherine M. Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Sieg informs the court this matter is not resolved and moves for trial date.
***DROP DEAD DATE 12/12/2016.
Motions and Jury Instructions due by 12/19/2016
Status conference on October 18, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Case called at 1:32 PM.
Defendant Deidrik Steven Rear in court with attorney Dennis Sieg..  Katherine M. Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
State moves to continue re: attorney Sieg's first appearance in this case.
Attorney Sieg files notice of appearance with the court.
So ordered.  Status conference scheduled for October 18, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Case called at 10:00 AM
Defendant Deidrik Steven Rear in court.   Katherine Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant acknowledges criminal complaint and waives reading.
Defendant informed of his right to counsel.
Defendant informs the court that he has retained attorney Sieg.
Court instructs defendant to have his counsel file a notice of retainer.
Court finds probable cause for filing.
Court reads charge portion onto the record.
State requests $1,000.00 Signature bond
>No threats or violent or abusive conduct toward T.R.
Defendant enters plea of "NOT GUILTY".
Defendant shall not threaten or engage in any violent or abusive conduct directed toward Trina Rear.
Initial appearance on August 29, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Bail Bond Envelope from Sheriff's Department in the amount of $300.00 paid by Julie A Paulson
